meanings.sent1: The honey was viscously dripping from the spoon.
meanings.sent2: The mud was so viscously clinging to my boots.
meanings.sent3: The glue was viscously holding the pieces together like a strong bond.
meanings.sent4: The fog was viscously enveloping the city, obscuring everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The caramel was viscously coating the apple, creating a delicious treat.

meanings.definition: In a manner showing a reluctance to change or adapt
meanings.sent1: She viscously resisted the idea of trying new foods.
meanings.sent2: He viscously clung to his old ways, refusing to embrace any change.
meanings.sent3: The cat viscously refused to move from its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The old clock viscously ticked on, unwilling to accept its time had passed.
meanings.sent5: The stubborn child viscously held onto his toy, unwilling to share with others.
